etymology.description: 叀(叀) (zhuān, "spindle") + 又(又) (yòu, "hand") = a hand turning a spindle -> semantic 寸(寸) (cùn, "inch") later replaced 又 -> focused meaning
etymology.interpretation: 專(zhuān) ("focused") combines the concept of a spindle, which symbolizes spinning or bundling, with the notion of a hand, suggesting action or manipulation. The hand component was later stylized to an inch, indicating precision or concentration, aligning with the idea of focusing multiple elements into one.

examples.chinese: 小明專心於數學(小明專心於數學)。
examples.pinyin: Xiǎo míng zhuān xīn yú shùxué.

examples.chinese: 書店專賣古籍(書店專賣古籍)，吸引眾多收藏家(吸引眾多收藏家)。
examples.pinyin: Shūdiàn zhuān mài gǔjí, xīyǐn zhòngduō shōu cáng jiā.
examples.english: The bookstore exclusively sells antique books, attracting many collectors.

examples.chinese: 工廠專注改進技術(工廠專注改進技術)。
examples.english: The factory is focused on improving its technology.
